{"step_by_step_thinking": "To determine if phosphoenolpyruvate carboxykinase 1 (PCK1) is the rate-limiting enzyme in gluconeogenesis, we need to examine the information provided in the relevant documents. Document [0] states that PCK1 is a main control point for the regulation of gluconeogenesis. Document [2] mentions that phosphoenolpyruvate carboxykinase (PCK) is one of the enzymes responsible for gluconeogenesis. Document [8] also mentions that the cytosolic form of PCK1 is the key enzyme of gluconeogenesis in the liver.
